class.name: PoolIntArray
class.description: An [Array] specifically designed to hold integer values ([int]). Optimized for memory usage, does not fragment the memory. [b]Note:[/b] This type is passed by value and not by reference.

method.name: PoolIntArray
method.description: Constructs a new [PoolIntArray]. Optionally, you can pass in a generic [Array] that will be converted.

method.name: append
method.description: Appends an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Appends a [PoolIntArray] at the end of this array.

method.name: insert
method.description: Inserts a new int at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array ([code]idx == size()[/code]).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverses the order of the elements in the array.

method.name: push_back
method.description: Appends a value to the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Sets the size of the array. If the array is grown, reserves elements at the end of the array. If the array is shrunk, truncates the array to the new size.

method.name: set
method.description: Changes the int at the given index.
